text: South Korea has reported a record daily
surge in new coronavirus cases taking
the total to more than three thousand
seventeen people have died it has the
highest number of confirmed cases
outside China where the outbreak started
the South Korean army has been mobilized
to disinfect the city of Daegu in the
region worst-affected I asked our
correspondent in Seoul
Laura Becker what was it the route of
the surge in numbers well it's believed
that the outbreak began within the Asian
chunji Church of Jesus this is a
religious sect which has around 220,000
members right across South Korea now
every single one of them are being
interviewed to find out if they have
symptoms of the virus so far over 3,000
see they do and one of the reasons why
officials are warning that there will be
a further spike in cases is as they test
more and more of these church members
more are testing positive so far around
80 percent of those that they've tested
in the Daegu area have tested positive
for the virus that is how they're trying
to track the spread of where the
infected patients are and where they
have been to try to isolate those and
contain the spread but it's becoming
increasingly obvious that this is
getting more and more difficult doctors
in Daegu say they are overwhelmed by the
number of patients coming forward to be
treated they're urging those with mild
symptoms now to stay at home over a
thousand patients are currently in
quarantine in the Daegu area asking for
hospital beds and now doctors are saying
look it's time that we treat the most
critical of cases Laura Baker there as
efforts to contain the virus continue
around the world an investigation by BBC
Persian suggests the number of corona
virus deaths in Iran could be more than
200 way above the official figures state
television there has confirmed 295 new
cases in the past 24 hours meanwhile
health officials on the west coast of
the United States say there are 3
unexplained cases there which Preston
reports the number of countries report a
new incidence of curve in 19 continues
to rise New Zealand Lithuania and
Iceland are amongst the latest
their first cases the World Health
Organization has upgraded the global
risk of the virus to its highest
possible level at least 210 people are
reported to have died in Iran as
authorities they're trying to get
control of the situation
Friday prayers were canceled for the
first time in 40 years worldwide there
have been more than two and a half
thousand deaths from this strain of
coronavirus Italy continues to be
Europe's biggest cause for concern with
more than 650 cases several towns in the
north of the country are still on
lockdown the United Nations says each
country has to do its bit we know
containment is possible but the window
of opportunity is narrowing
and so I appeal for solidarity and full
global supports but with all countries
fully assuming their responsibilities
even North Korea is taking action it
hasn't officially reported any cases but
sources in South Korea say the virus has
been detected there its border with
China has been shot and schools are
closed North Korea's leader Kim jong-un
has reportedly told his officials to
strengthen checkups and quarantine in
the United States a third case of
community contagion our third case did
not recently travel overseas or have any
known contact with a recent traveler or
an infected person the number of
infections across the country has passed
50 other countries that haven't yet had
any confirmed cases of the virus are
preparing bracing themselves for what is
likely the inevitable rich Preston BBC
news
